name: I RAN SO FAR AWAY. / IRAN SO FAR AWAY.
description: Sometimes you, the reader, will see repetition of what seems like the exact same sentence, with the same number of letters and punctuation, but one small detail will be different; this has been done on purpose. In this case, both sentences are valid sentences and work grammatically. The only difference here is that the letter "I" is separated from the word "RAN". Playing on proximity and the inherent context distance it alludes to we finD ourselves in a conundrum of sorts. We have one sentence that shows that I, personally, ran so far away and also the country IRAN is so far away from us in North America. Both factual statement and yet only one space can create completely different thoughts.
